key_title: Key to the genera of Polypodiaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fronds well-spaced along rhizome, usually articulated; stipe prominent (at least on feritle fronds), lacking wing, or winged only in upper half; sori round or oval-shaped
Fronds clustered or crowded on rhizome, not atriculated; stipe indistinct, winged almost to base; sori linear or oval-shaped
Fronds more than 10 cm long. simple or pinnately lobed, glabrous or with sparse scales; veins evident; sori rather distant
Fronts less than 10 cm long, simple, lower surface densely matted with stellate hairs; veins obscure in thick lamina; sori crowded
